sen.j: 本巣国造（もとすのくにみやつこ・もとすこくぞう）は美濃国中西部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Motosunokunimiyatsuko (also known as Motosukokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the central west of Mino Province.
Motosu no kunimiyatsuko (also known as Motosukokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the central west of Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Motosu no kunimiyatsuko (also known as Motosukokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the central west of Mino Province.

sen.j: 『古事記』によると彦坐王の子の八瓜入日子王が祖という。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki", Yatsuriirihikonomiko, a son of Hikoimasuo, was the ancestor.
According to "Kojiki," Yatsuriirihikonomiko, a son of Hikoimasuo, was the ancestor.

sen.j: 現在の岐阜県本巣市・瑞穂市・北方町。
sen.e: Present Motosu City, Mizuho City, Kitagatacho in Gifu Prefecture.
Present Motosu City, Mizuho City, Kitagatacho in Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: 後に美濃国全域を支配し、三野国造になったという。
sen.e: Later, the clan ruled over Mino Province and became Minonokuninomiyatsuko.
Later, the clan ruled over Mino Province and became Mino no kuninomiyatsuko.
